description: Office 365 is a cloud based productivity suite for individuals, companies and even government agencies. It is designed to deliver software as service to any and every user regardless of location. The Office 365 solution is designed to relieve the technical challenge of software management and delivery, regardless of location from the local IT personnel. This allows the IT professional to focus in implementing, deploying and operating Office 365 services and administrating supporting technologies, like email, collaboration and storage. If youâ€™re an IT professional who takes part in evaluating, planning, deploying, and operating the Office 365 services, including its dependencies, requirements, and supporting technologies this series will demonstrate and help you to see what is involved in setting up Office 365 for your organization.
descriptionMD: Office 365 is a cloud based productivity suite for individuals, companies and even government agencies. It is designed to deliver software as service to any and every user regardless of location. The Office 365 solution is designed to relieve the technical challenge of software management and delivery, regardless of location from the local IT personnel. This allows the IT professional to focus in implementing, deploying and operating Office 365 services and administrating supporting technologies, like email, collaboration and storage. If youâ€™re an IT professional who takes part in evaluating, planning, deploying, and operating the Office 365 services, including its dependencies, requirements, and supporting technologies this series will demonstrate and help you to see what is involved in setting up Office 365 for your organization.
name: Microsoft Office 365 - 70-346 (2017)
subtitle: Managing Office 365 Identities and Requirements

episodes.description: a
episodes.title: Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.081 --> 00:00:05.864
[MUSIC]

2
00:00:05.864 --> 00:00:10.088
Welcome to the Managing Office 365
Identities and Requirements show.

3
00:00:10.088 --> 00:00:15.134
This particular overview is actually meant
to help you to not only get ready for

4
00:00:15.134 --> 00:00:19.568
the exam, but to also prepare you for
implementing Office 365 for

5
00:00:19.568 --> 00:00:23.105
a company or for
a customer that you may have, as well.

6
00:00:23.105 --> 00:00:24.315
So, let's go ahead and

7
00:00:24.315 --> 00:00:27.714
take a look at what you have to do
to get through this exam, as well.

8
00:00:27.714 --> 00:00:29.282
Some of the exam details.

9
00:00:29.282 --> 00:00:32.776
I simply took a search engine that
I launched up through my browser.

10
00:00:32.776 --> 00:00:35.981
Typed in exam 70-346.

11
00:00:35.981 --> 00:00:38.581
That number is gonna be very helpful for
you.

12
00:00:38.581 --> 00:00:41.741
And also take a note at
the exam title itself.

13
00:00:41.741 --> 00:00:45.559
Manage Office 365 Identities and
Requirements.

14
00:00:45.559 --> 00:00:50.528
Both of those are going to be necessary
as you register for the exam.

15
00:00:50.528 --> 00:00:53.731
Whether it's through Pearson VUE
online portal itself, or

16
00:00:53.731 --> 00:00:57.685
whether you go to a Pearson VUE center and
you decide to register manually,

17
00:00:57.685 --> 00:01:00.602
both of those are actually
gonna be used at some point.

18
00:01:00.602 --> 00:01:03.448
They're either gonna ask you for
the name of the exam, or

19
00:01:03.448 --> 00:01:05.939
they're gonna ask you to
verify the exam number,

20
00:01:05.939 --> 00:01:10.058
you'll need to know both of them to make
sure that you can get scheduled in, okay?

21
00:01:10.058 --> 00:01:14.417
This particular exam itself
has been around for a long,

22
00:01:14.417 --> 00:01:19.532
I say a long time, a while,
at least since February of 2014.

23
00:01:19.532 --> 00:01:24.825
So it is a relatively mature
exam in terms of what we see.

24
00:01:24.825 --> 00:01:30.315
Now that doesn't mean that this exam
though in what we've also prepared for

25
00:01:30.315 --> 00:01:32.989
in the show is going to be old, okay?

26
00:01:32.989 --> 00:01:37.263
And that is because, as of June 2017,

27
00:01:37.263 --> 00:01:40.719
the exam itself has been updated.

28
00:01:40.719 --> 00:01:44.457
So make sure you check this out, okay?

29
00:01:44.457 --> 00:01:49.991
If you're actually of course past June of
2017, you're gonna need to download and

30
00:01:49.991 --> 00:01:54.806
review all of the changes that were
made to the exam objectives themselves.

31
00:01:54.806 --> 00:02:00.129
The exam objectives are actually broken
out into six different domains divided

32
00:02:00.129 --> 00:02:05.464
up by different percentages that you may
actually end up seeing as well, okay?

33
00:02:05.464 --> 00:02:10.242
So those domains of course will divide up
into skills that you'll need to be aware

34
00:02:10.242 --> 00:02:10.746
of too.

35
00:02:10.746 --> 00:02:15.424
Now just when we talk about those
skills and understanding them,

36
00:02:15.424 --> 00:02:19.861
it doesn't mean that those
are limited to those skills only.

37
00:02:19.861 --> 00:02:23.807
If I flip on over here,
this is where that link takes you.

38
00:02:23.807 --> 00:02:26.647
Here is the latest exam
objectives according

39
00:02:26.647 --> 00:02:29.411
to the site that they've changed here, and

40
00:02:29.411 --> 00:02:34.132
you can see where it says, document
shows changes to scoping statements.

41
00:02:34.132 --> 00:02:38.196
These changes were
effective as of June 2017.

42
00:02:38.196 --> 00:02:43.170
You wanna make sure that you are prepared
for this exam, not only by, of course,

43
00:02:43.170 --> 00:02:46.244
understanding what
the skills measured are, but

44
00:02:46.244 --> 00:02:48.754
notice who should take the exam itself.

45
00:02:48.754 --> 00:02:49.912
So at this point,

46
00:02:49.912 --> 00:02:54.408
you have to actually be experienced
in a couple of different things.

47
00:02:54.408 --> 00:02:57.148
And this is what I want
you to focus in on.

48
00:02:57.148 --> 00:03:01.840
Candidates should have experience
with Office 365 admin center, and

49
00:03:01.840 --> 00:03:06.231
understanding of Microsoft Exchange
Online, Skype for Business,

50
00:03:06.231 --> 00:03:11.625
SharePoint Online, Office 365 ProPlus,
and Windows Azure Active Directory.

51
00:03:11.625 --> 00:03:14.875
And it also includes experience
in service descriptions,

52
00:03:14.875 --> 00:03:18.710
configuration integration services,
with identity management and

53
00:03:18.710 --> 00:03:23.264
on premises infrastructure, to support
some of the business requirements here.

54
00:03:23.264 --> 00:03:28.110
So this is not meant for someone is just
saying, hey, I'm just jumping at this and

55
00:03:28.110 --> 00:03:30.792
I should just jump right into Office 365.

56
00:03:30.792 --> 00:03:35.064
Now it doesn't mean that can't do that,
know it means it's gonna be much more

57
00:03:35.064 --> 00:03:39.142
difficult for you if you don't have
some of those skills already set down,

58
00:03:39.142 --> 00:03:43.111
or if you're not familiar with
the products that are listed right here.

59
00:03:43.111 --> 00:03:48.361
So my suggestions, of course,
is that before you end up just taking even

60
00:03:48.361 --> 00:03:53.609
this first exam, make sure you also
take a look at the 70-347 skill

61
00:03:53.609 --> 00:03:58.687
objectives there as well to understand
how you enable the services and

62
00:03:58.687 --> 00:04:03.679
manage those services as well to get
all those things up an running and

63
00:04:03.679 --> 00:04:06.636
understand those products too, okay?

64
00:04:06.636 --> 00:04:10.541
So that way you'll be familiar with some
of the requirements that they're talking

65
00:04:10.541 --> 00:04:11.498
about this way too.

66
00:04:11.498 --> 00:04:15.301
So once you have that in your mind and
you're ready to go,

67
00:04:15.301 --> 00:04:19.598
here are some of the episodes
that we should be covering, okay?

68
00:04:19.598 --> 00:04:24.196
Underneath the provisioning,
we talk about provisioning tenants, okay?

69
00:04:24.196 --> 00:04:25.366
What does that actually mean?

70
00:04:25.366 --> 00:04:26.992
And how do we begin to do it?

71
00:04:26.992 --> 00:04:28.953
And what are the best practices for those?

72
00:04:28.953 --> 00:04:34.307
We also begin to add in and configure,
of course, a custom domain.

73
00:04:34.307 --> 00:04:39.762
And when we talk about, we'll also talk
about of course the use of DNS ownership.

74
00:04:39.762 --> 00:04:43.610
We'll also take a look at registering
those DNS records the way that we need

75
00:04:43.610 --> 00:04:44.230
to as well.

76
00:04:44.230 --> 00:04:46.809
And the updating and
verifying domain settings.

77
00:04:46.809 --> 00:04:52.427
The ones that we see in red are of course,
the added end objectives that we had,

78
00:04:52.427 --> 00:04:57.560
or a change objective that has been
put in place since June of 2016.

79
00:04:57.560 --> 00:04:59.866
We also go through planning a pilot and

80
00:04:59.866 --> 00:05:02.686
we'll take a look at
delegating pilot users.

81
00:05:02.686 --> 00:05:07.191
We will also end up running some of these
different tests here that they talk about.

82
00:05:07.191 --> 00:05:12.043
As well as understanding the use
of the fast track Office to

83
00:05:12.043 --> 00:05:15.516
onboard Office 365 services as well.

84
00:05:15.516 --> 00:05:19.749
We'll also of course configure all
of our DNS records that we need to,

85
00:05:19.749 --> 00:05:23.933
we'll take a look at that as well and
make sure that they are working.

86
00:05:23.933 --> 00:05:28.067
Client connectivity, we will of
course address client connectivity.

87
00:05:28.067 --> 00:05:32.877
We'll talk about the ability to protect
all of our files and documents the way

88
00:05:32.877 --> 00:05:37.771
that we want to with the integration with
the Azure Rights Management as well.

89
00:05:37.771 --> 00:05:40.279
And we'll see some of
the set up templates for

90
00:05:40.279 --> 00:05:42.926
Rights Management to
help us to protect email.

91
00:05:42.926 --> 00:05:48.569
We'll manage the administrator
roles that are there and available.

92
00:05:48.569 --> 00:05:51.844
We'll talk about those roles briefly,
make sure you

93
00:05:51.844 --> 00:05:56.666
understand where you configure those for
your users inside of Office 365.

94
00:05:56.666 --> 00:05:59.797
We'll also take a look at
cloud identity management,

95
00:05:59.797 --> 00:06:04.372
where we configure password management,
as well as user and security groups.

96
00:06:04.372 --> 00:06:08.226
We'll also of course,
implement the Azure AD Connect tool.

97
00:06:08.226 --> 00:06:11.285
This is probably the biggest update,

98
00:06:11.285 --> 00:06:15.785
at least since the last domain
was updated here, okay?

99
00:06:15.785 --> 00:06:19.801
Now it's not that they didn't call this
out on a previous iteration of the exam.

100
00:06:19.801 --> 00:06:23.941
It's just that the tool may have been
available, but the tool may not have been

101
00:06:23.941 --> 00:06:27.023
available, because it was in
transition for a long time.

102
00:06:27.023 --> 00:06:30.379
But we'll actually get that
implemented when we prepare for

103
00:06:30.379 --> 00:06:33.424
single sign on Active Directory for
Azure AD Connect.

104
00:06:33.424 --> 00:06:36.049
We'll set up the Azure AD Connect
tool itself and

105
00:06:36.049 --> 00:06:39.827
then we'll actually show you how to
manage Active Directory users and

106
00:06:39.827 --> 00:06:43.176
groups using the Connect tool
while it's actually in place.

107
00:06:43.176 --> 00:06:46.600
And we'll talk about the topology
that needs to be implemented as well.

108
00:06:46.600 --> 00:06:51.806
Then probably the largest scope of
what we'll deal with is the idea here

109
00:06:51.806 --> 00:06:57.622
of using and implementing single sign-on
between your on-premises domain,

110
00:06:57.622 --> 00:07:02.222
as well as your Azure Active
Directory Federation Services and

111
00:07:02.222 --> 00:07:04.413
your domain up there as well.

112
00:07:04.413 --> 00:07:08.629
So we will, of course, plan out for
Active Directory Federation Services.

113
00:07:08.629 --> 00:07:12.542
We'll install and manage the actual
federation server itself,

114
00:07:12.542 --> 00:07:17.174
including the certificates, and
we'll also implement a proxy server too.

115
00:07:17.174 --> 00:07:20.797
So we'll see all that information that's
going to be available there, too.

116
00:07:20.797 --> 00:07:25.632
Lastly, of course, we'll spend a little
bit of time taking a look at reports.

117
00:07:25.632 --> 00:07:28.432
We'll talk about how we
can monitor to health,

118
00:07:28.432 --> 00:07:32.633
and isolate service interruption
using the tools that are available.

119
00:07:32.633 --> 00:07:36.462
In this last section we also see some
of these tools are deprecated and

120
00:07:36.462 --> 00:07:40.767
we'll mention some of the things that
we might have to be able to understand.

121
00:07:40.767 --> 00:07:44.412
But even though they're deprecated they're
still called out on the exam objectives.

122
00:07:44.412 --> 00:07:46.874
So make sure you pay attention there too.

123
00:07:46.874 --> 00:07:52.124
But overall though, if this seems like
what you're heading your career towards,

124
00:07:52.124 --> 00:07:56.474
or you're gonna be managing Office 365,
this is a great place for

125
00:07:56.474 --> 00:08:00.155
you to begin to understand how
to get all that configured.

126
00:08:00.155 --> 00:08:04.544
And you'll also be able to prepare for
this first exam and your MCSA.

127
00:08:04.544 --> 00:08:08.237
So, if you're ready to do that,
join us in the very next episode.

128
00:08:08.237 --> 00:08:14.379
[MUSIC]

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie introduce how to setup an Office 365 tenant. They introduce the basic tenant provision steps.  They review the best practices for tenant account provisioning.
episodes.title: Provision Office365 Tenants

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie continue with the Office 365 setup.  They show the initial Global Administrator account and assign some subscription.  They add an additional user and make the user a different type of administrator for the tenant.  Lastly they show where the billing can be seen and talk about handling licensing issues.
episodes.title: Provision Office365 Tenants Pt2

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie use the Office 365 Admin Center to configure the tenant for new features and updates.  They describe the use and show where to configure these settings for the tenant.  They remind us that this only affects software that has been downloaded with those settings not software setup with different settings.
episodes.title: Configure for New Features

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie explain some basic DNS concepts to help setup Office 365 to work with a Custom Domain Name. They describe how to add a custom domain name and work with DNS records to make it work with Office 365.
episodes.title: Add and Configure Custom Domain

episodes.description: Description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie explain some basic DNS concepts to help setup Office 365 to work with a Custom Domain Name. They describe how to add a custom domain name and work with DNS records to make it work with Office 365.
episodes.title: Add and Configure Custom Domain Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Zach explore what it takes to plan a pilot.  They provide an overview of the steps to get a pilot started.  They discuss the types of users who should be included in it. Also, they talk about some of the workloads that do not need to be migrated.  Lastly, they demonstrate the use of a tool that tests the Health, Readiness and Connectivity.
episodes.title: Pilot Users and Workloads

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Zach show the use of IdFix.  They discuss the reason to use IdFix and its importance if you have an on-premises AD and want to use directory sychronization.  Lastly, they also discuss creating a basic test plan
episodes.title: Run Idfix

episodes.description: In this episode, Ronnie and Zach demonstrate the steps to setting up email for Pilot Users. They show each step and  discuss what must be considered for a successful pilot to take place.
episodes.title: Setup Email for Pilot User

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to get the help of the FastTrack Center to onboard Office 365 services.
episodes.title: Engage Fasttrack Center for Office

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss and show how to enable client connectivity to Office 365. They review the records that need to be added to the DNS registrar for email, communication and collaboration to work. Also they focus in on configurations on proxy and firewall to access Office 365 Keywords: dns,srv records, ns records, mx records, srv records, firewall settings, proxy settings.
episodes.title: Enable Client Connectivity

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to manage rights management through Azure. They demonstrate how to activate it and assign roles for rights management.
episodes.title: Administer Azure Rights Management

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to manage rights management through Azure. They use powershell to begin some management configuration of admnistrators and super user too.
episodes.title: Administer Azure Rights Management Pt2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to manage rights management through Azure.  They use powershell to begin some management configuration of admnistrators and super user too.
episodes.title: Administer Azure Rights Management Pt3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie examine the different admin roles in Office 365. They also show configure those roles in the admin center and PowerShell.
episodes.title: Manage Office 365 Administrator Roles

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to manage users and passwords. They configure the password management for the tenant. Also they discuss and demonstrate how to manage user groups and bulk add users too.
episodes.title: Manage Passwords and Users

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to manage users and passwords.  They configure the password management for the tenant.  Also they discuss and demonstrate how to manage user groups and bulk add users too.
episodes.title: Manage Passwords and Users Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie help us to get started using MFA on our Office 365 accounts to better protect our authentication process.  They discuss the benefits and issues using MFA for authentication
episodes.title: Manage Passwords and Users Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie talk about managing identities with powershell.  They emphasize the use of powershell in configuring passwords, creating bulk user accounts with CSV files, user account management such as licensing management and deleting accounts one at a time or in bulk.
episodes.title: Cloud Identities with PowerShell

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review some of the Azure AD cmdlets.  These commands require connecting to Office 365 and or Azure AD.  They review multiple cmdlets to help with user management, group management, service principal management, domain management and administrative unit management.
episodes.title: Azure Active Directory Cmdlets

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie review some of the Azure AD cmdlets.  These commands require connecting to Office 365 and or Azure AD.  They review multiple cmdlets to help with user management, group management, service principal management, domain management and administrative unit management.
episodes.title: Azure Active Directory Cmdlets Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to create security groups in Office 365.  They demonstrate creating, editing and deleting a security group using the admin center interface and using the powershell connection to do so.
episodes.title: Create Security Groups

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss integration of on-premises Active Directory and Azure Active Directory.
episodes.title: Prepare AD Synchronization to O365

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss integration of on-premises Active Directory and Azure Active Directory.
episodes.title: Prepare AD Synchronization to O365 Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Zach take a look at fitering Active Directory. They cover various types of filtering such as group-based, domain-based, OU-based and attribute-based filtering.
episodes.title: Plan for Filtering Active Directory

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Zach take a look at fitering Active Directory. They cover various types of filtering such as group-based, domain-based, OU-based and attribute-based filtering.
episodes.title: Plan for Filtering Active Directory Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Ronnie and Zach take a look at fitering Active Directory. They cover various types of filtering such as group-based, domain-based, OU-based and attribute-based filtering.
episodes.title: Plan for Filtering Active Directory Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the best practices when setting up the Azure AD Connect Tool. They also review the prerequisites to make the AD Connect Tool work
episodes.title: Set Up Azure AD Connect Tool

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show the connection steps and discuss the setup for the Azure AD Connect Tool to work.  They show the synchronization and then show some of the different considerations after the AD Connect Tool is in place and ready to go
episodes.title: Set Up Azure AD Connect Tool Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show the connection steps and discuss the setup for the Azure AD Connect Tool to work.  They show the synchronization and then show some of the different considerations after the AD Connect Tool is in place and ready to go
episodes.title: Set Up Azure AD Connect Tool Part 3

episodes.description: In this episode, Cherokee and Ronnie show the connection steps and discuss the setup for the Azure AD Connect Tool to work.  They show the synchronization and then show some of the different considerations after the AD Connect Tool is in place and ready to go
episodes.title: Set Up Azure AD Connect Tool Part 4

topics.title: Manage Identities with Azure Active Directory Connect

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss how to prepare and plan for implementation of ADFS for our connection to Office 365.  They describe what it does for us and why we need it.  Lastly, they also discuss what are some of the elements that we must have together before we begin implementing it for our Office 365 environment.
episodes.title: Plan AD FS Requirements

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie begin with the basic installation requirements and install the ADFS server for use.  After completing the installation and post-configuration, they use the Azure AD Connect tool to complete and verify ADFS is working correctly.
episodes.title: Install and Manage AD FS Server

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss the use and need of the Web Access Proxy Server for the SSO.  They talk about some of the additional prequisites to allow it work.  They also describer how users from outside of our domain will use the web access proxy.
episodes.title: Install Web Access Proxy

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie take a moment to install the Web Access Proxy role and configure it's certificate to work.
episodes.title: Install Web Access Proxy Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie walk through the post-installation configuration for the proxy
episodes.title: Configure Web Access Proxy

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show how to customize the ADFS Sign-In-Page. This allows O365 admins to customize the end-user experience for their needs, according to the team. They describe many options that can be changed and demonstrate how to change some of them using powershell.
episodes.title: Customize ADFS Sign-in Page

topics.title: Implement and Manage Federated Identities for SSO

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie demonstrate some of the different methods to get information about the past history and current health of the O365 tenant. They show where you can find reports within the 0365 portal and used the Service Health Dashboard.
episodes.title: Analyze Reports and Monitor Service Health

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie show some of the different methods to isolate Service Interruption.  They show some of the different tools available for the admin monitoring the O365.
episodes.title: Isolate Service Interruption

episodes.description: n this episode, Zach and Ronnie demonstrate some of the steps necessary when you disable adfs and keep password synchonization running.
episodes.title: Disabling AD Federation

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie demonstrate some of the steps necessary when you disable adfs and keep password synchonization running.
episodes.title: Disabling AD Federation Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode, Zach and Ronnie discuss rights managements basics. They discuss the problems that companies face protecting email and documents.  Then, they discuss how Rights Managment provides a solution for protecting our data, regardless of who receives the data, where it resides and technology available.
episodes.title: Document and Email Protection

topics.title: Monitor and troubleshoot Office 365 availability and usage
